title: Scarlett Moffatt has moved in with boyfriend Scott Dobinson
text:
Scarlett Moffatt has taken her relationship to the next step as she has moved in with boyfriend Scott Dobinson.

The former Gogglebox star, 29, and the policeman recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Venice to celebrate Scarlett's birthday and have now decided to move in together.

She told The Mirror: 'It's only happened in the last few weeks and it's so new we are still laughing and smiling about it.'

Romance: Scarlett Moffatt, 29, has taken her relationship to the next step as she has moved in with boyfriend Scott Dobinson

Scarlett added that she believes Scott is 'the one' and that he has been warmly embraced by her family unlike some of her past boyfriends.

She said: 'I think he's the one, but I feel that whenever I say that in public I doom my life! I'll just have to hope he is. I've had some absolute a***holes in the past. My family really like Scott.

'I've had boyfriends my mum hasn't liked and, when you are younger, you see that as a challenge.'

Scarlett shared a glimpse at her Venice holiday with Scott on social media and admitted she isn't where she thought she would be at 29.

Love: The former Gogglebox star and the policeman recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Venice to celebrate Scarlett's birthday and have now decided to move in together

In an honest post, she wrote: '29 years old today!! It’s crazy when I was 18 I thought by the time I was 29 I’d be married, have 2 children, have all my whizz together. Am I where I thought I would be at 29, absolutely not...

'Is that a good thing, absolutely. If I can pass any wisdom on in my old age is that it’s a great thing having no particular path as you can take any path or opportunity that comes your way. And embrace the changes that happen in your life...

'You might think you are not where you are meant to be, but the chances are YOU ARE EXACTLY WHERE YOUR MEANT TO BE! Life is far too important to take seriously, be happy and care less ❤️ #birthday #wisdom #love'.

The TV star's birthday celebrations are a marked difference from her 27th birthday which saw her break up with then boyfriend Luke Crodden.

Scarlett said: 'It's only happened in the last few weeks and it's so new we are still laughing and smiling about it'

Scarlett previously shared a loved-up snap to her Instagram account of her and Scott looking cosy in two similar snaps.

Alongside the post, Scarlett noted that the couple prefer to keep their love life private and encouraged her followers to never give up looking for love.

She wrote: 'We keep our life quite private and he hates it when I post but honestly I’ve never felt love like this.

'Please never give up on finding your soul mate no matter how many bad experiences you have.'

Trip: Scarlett shared a glimpse at her Venice holiday with Scott on social media and admitted she isn't where she thought she would be at 29

The couple are said to have first began dating in March after meeting through a mutual friend.

After soaring to fame on the Channel 4 show alongside her family, Scarlett has gone on to become a household name, having starred on huge shows including I’m A Celebrity, Saturday Night Takeaway and Streetmate.

But with newfound fame comes naysayers, with the County Durham native having sadly faced her fair share of internet trolls and body shamers.

Holiday: She also shared photos of the couple enjoying a romantic meal in the Italian city

Scarlett previously revealed that she privately messages body shamers on social media to ask if they’re okay as she discusses how she tackles negative criticism.

She said: ‘So, a couple of times I have actually messaged people and said, “are you okay?” and every time I’ve done that, they’ve always messaged back and said, “I’m so sorry!” So hopefully they learn from it.’

Pointing out the downside to her bold actions, she added: ‘Unfortunately, you can’t spend all your time messaging people asking if they’re alright!’

It’s not just Scarlett who has her own way of coping with the criticism, her mother Betty also has a tried and tested method of releasing her anger when her daughter is trolled.

‘My mum will write out her response to the trolls but will never actually post it, she just deletes it!’ she explained. ‘She’s always like “I just want to press send!” and I’m like “you can’t! It would be everywhere; you can’t press send!” '
description: The former Gogglebox star, 29, and the policeman recently enjoyed a romantic trip to Venice to celebrate Scarlett's birthday and have now decided to move in together.
